course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Science, Technology and Business
course.description: Examines the relationship between science, technology and business. Course topics include: economic and business dimensions of technology and innovation, business strategies for science and technology, and technology management.

reviews.author: youuu

40% midterm
45% final

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content:
The content includes topics on Science, origin of science, technology, relation between science and technology, types of technologies, innovation, industrial revolution, system model of innovation, diffusion of innovation, innovation and businesses, R&D.

The course covers quite a lot. It might become boring for a few lectures, but the professor tries to keep it interesting, has mini breaks every class + 1 PRS question per class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Sharif is very good. He doesn't change the content too much from previous semesters. Gives out a few sample questions to practice before the midterm and final.
reviews.comment_grading:
PRS - 15%
Midterm - 40%
Final - 45%

Grading isn't very lenient for the course. Mean for the exams tend to stay around 28/40 and 32/45 respectively (Course mean score ~ 73). Mean grade is usually B- and a very high course score is needed for an A or A+, which is not hard to get if one goes to lectures and takes short notes.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is minimal, but yes, going to class definitely helps as Prof. Sharif tests some of the concepts that he might explain verbally in class and also, his explanations make it easier to understand the slides. (The slides have quite a lot of content and not too much graphics).

He does have readings throughout the semester but only tests them in the midterm. So, reading them will be important for the midterm.

All exams are MCQ's.

reviews.author: Alvinlty
reviews.title: Worth it

reviews.author: moonbaby
reviews.comment_content:
Professor Sharif's course is extremely passionate about the subject the course mainly focuses on innovation and how it is related to the business world and our society. To be honest, Professor Sharif goes out of his way to relate the subject matter to our every day life and make the course information more interesting and relatable. I really enjoyed learning about systems of innovation and the process of innovations and the industrial revolution.

The content is very interesting for both science and business students alike since it really focuses on the impact of technology, how technology can affect economic development, interesting aspects about microinnovations, the interdependence of science and business.

Moreover, it helps you gain a better perspective on our society and how technology has grown to shape it and has been shaped by it. I highly recommend the content of the course to people who would like to think more analytically about the world of science and business. The concepts learned are quite interesting and can be very philosophical. For example, we learned a part of the innovation process in businesses which involves reverse salients. Reverse salients are basically problems or weaknesses the innovation has which prevents it from developing further or diffusing more wider.  Professor Sharif relates it back to the students in their attempt to grow telling us that sometimes all it takes is to identify the problem.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I e-mailed Professor Sharif a couple of times and he was more than happy to help me and responded with a prompt e-mail. He is also extremely passionate about the subject matter and goes out of his way to help the students.

After the midterms he collected a survey which asked on the ways to improve his teaching and removed a lot of the readings and the workload and made a lot of the PRS exercises much later.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading on this course is okay. In order to get A range you would have to be in the top 15% of the entire 400 person course, B range is 40%, C range is the next 35-40% and so on.

The course breakdown:
Midterm 40%
Final Exam 45%
IPRS exercises 15%

I received 35/40 on the midterm (around 2 SD above the mean)
I received 37.5/ 45 on the final exam (around 1 SD above the mean)
I got 15/15 for the PRS (a little above the mean) The PRS questions are based on the readings assigned.
Final score: A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty good, the readings may be a bit difficult for people who struggle with English but professor also explains the readings during class and a lot of the lecture contents overlap with the readings. As long as you keep up with the weekly readings and take notes during class the course is pretty manageable.

reviews.author: Kyle Cheng
reviews.title: Interesting Course with Passionate Professor, however the grade may not be so good
reviews.comment_content: The course is quite fundamental and matches the name of common core courses. Perfectly described something about innovations among the history.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very good plus having one of the best accents in UST. He will play lots of music collected from students during the break.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not very easy to get in A range, to be honest.
Usually, you'll have to score mean+1.5 sd both in midterm and final along with full marks in IPRS in order to get in A range.
reviews.comment_workload: There are quite a lot of readings to go through every week. They are not compulsory nor graded; however, it WILL appears on both midterm and final. Plus, there are many course PPTs to prepare.

reviews.author: mei you qian
reviews.title: Good Choice for Electives
reviews.comment_content:
The lecture does not have any textbooks or Pearson sort of materials. It only consists of lecture notes (slideshows) made by him and the assigned reading materials. Slideshows are generally well organized as well so you can study from the slides. As long as you study everything on the slides and have some critical thinking skills, it is not difficult to get high grades from the exam.

Contents of the course are not that daunting either - they are more or less general knowledge about history and tech businessses. The prof often focuses on Hong Kong's cases which is great.
reviews.comment_teaching:
One of the best profs I ever had in terms of teaching.
One great thing about this prof is that he knows what he should exactly teach and convey in the lecture (there weren't many profs who knew this in my experience). He has a sense of humour as well and tries to keep up the atmosphere of the lecture - successful for most of the time. One can tell he is enthusiastic about what he is teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is not generous but more than acceptable. The prof explains exactly how the grading will work transparently and so does his TA when you ask regarding your grade through email.

The expected grade distribution (which is subject to change under special or unforeseen circumstances), is as follows:
A: 15%
B: 40%
C: 35-40%
D: 5%
F: Remainder

Mid-term and final exams account for 40% and 45% of your total grade respectively. 15% comes from iPRS exercises conducted in class so make sure you are there.

Exams are all multiple choice.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is generally light although weekly readings could be quite substantial, especially if your English proficiency is not high. But the prof would listen to your opinions in the survey so if you feel like the reading is too much, make sure you let him know (in this sem, he also reduced the amount of readings for us).
Other than readings and studying for mid-term and final exams, there is no other workload at all.

reviews.author: Justin Li
reviews.title: Common Core course with few workload
reviews.comment_content: The course covers topics within science and technology (S&T) studies, including social view of science and technology, industrial revolution, and the impact of S&T on economy and businesses. Although the coverage is broad, contents are easy to understand and no prior knowledge is needed.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor explains the concepts clearly using simple real-life examples and supplement with some comments, and most of his references can be found in lecture slides so classes are easily to follow. Students with weaker English backgrounds will find it harder to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term 40%, final 45%, PRS 15%
Both mid-term and final exams are solely MCQs, which makes it easier and tricky at the same time. Mid-term mean 67.5%, questions are more straight forward. Final mean 71%, and contains 5 true or false questions that deducts 0.5 marks per incorrect answer.
Because PRS accounts quite large portion of grades, attendance is somewhat important.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite low, no hand-in work, exams have only MCQs. Have to attend lectures as PRS takes up to 15% of final grade. Most of the work is to memorize course contents to prepare for exam.

reviews.author: Nandi

40% - Mid-term

reviews.comment_workload: There isn't much work outside class. There is normally a reading for every week (about 4 or 5 pages). The English language requirement for the course is quite high.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.comment_content:
I would recite what was stated in the course outline for the best of your understanding:

‚ÄúThis course introduces newly emerging...science, technology and society (STS) and...applications to business practices...also aimed at students with backgrounds in business, science and engineering, or the humanities...what we mean by science and technology (S&T); the mutual relationship between S&T and business...how S&T have intervened historically...how S&T and business have become increasingly interconnected over time...how they contribute to greater profits in the wider spheres of economics, business and finance.‚Äù

I would say it's nothing more than gibberish often used by humanities' men to flaunt their ‚Äúunique understanding‚Äù of the world. I'm a science student seeing NO point why I should be taught ‚Äúwhat science is‚Äù by a humanities' professor.

I don't think we science students would understand less the workout of our own disciplines than humanities' men.

Perhaps, Dr. Naubahar is compelled by the school to create such a course that he may even subconsciously flout.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Naubahar is a good teacher in that he is very humorous, interactive and responsive in his preaching. He always made us laugh and played English pop songs at the start and during recess to entertain us. He welcomed us to send songs from YouTube to his email, which he decided whether they could be played in class.

Following the mid-term exam, he distributed feedback forms to us and asked us to write whatever improvements we wanted for the course. He did care about us a lot.

He even offered, at the last lesson, to hire students as helpers to work for him in bettering his course at a rate of $40+/hour. I'm not interested, but students who have just completed this course may find him.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-Term Exam: 40%
Final Exam: 45%
iPRS: 15%

He claimed that the top 55% could get at least B range.

For good sake of your 15% iPRS, GO TO CLASS!
reviews.comment_workload: Revise, revise & revise.

reviews.author: 3ub
reviews.title: Best Course, Best Professor
reviews.comment_content:
As the title implies, the context is about science, business, and technology. Personally, as a science student, this course was not much of a pressure since it does not go so deep into the business sector. I think it is a good balance between science related issues and business related issues.
Overall, I think this course is suitable for all students regardless of their major.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very enthusiastic with good english. He was the best professor I have met until now. He is also very passionate. He adjusts his courses as he goes along. For instance, he listens to student's opinion about the length of the exam, the difficulty, and the amount of reading material. He is very cooperative and helpful when students have questions.

The powerpoint is very organized and easy to follow. Prep for mid terms and finals were much more easier compared to other courses, because the ppt is neat and was in order.
reviews.comment_grading:
Three parts composed in the grading
IPRS 15%
Mid term 40%
Finals 45%

IPRS is basically just free marks for you. The difficulty of mid term was okay, so the average is quite high compared to other subjects. The average was 27.21/40. The sd was 5.6. The final exam was 45 questions. The average was 32.77/40. The sd was 6.29.

I thought I did so bad on both of the exams, but the results came out fine. The grading system is very fair.

Overall, I think the course itself is quite generous in grading system.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workloads are not too much. This course does iprs during class, which requires you to be physically in class. But they are basically free 15% for you, so I think this is not a problem.

The reading materials seems a lot, but the ppt and professor's lectures contain majority of the information. Only the mid terms contained the reading materials, final exam did not include the reading material.
If you want 100% in mid terms, I would encourage reading all the materials. But there are only 3~4 questions directly from the readings. In short, there is not that much extra work to do.

reviews.comment_teaching: Brilliant teaching. Listens to students' opinions and tries to accommodate them (even though the class is obnoxiously large!) E.g. lengthened time allowed for the finals after some students commented on the tight timing in the mid-term.
reviews.comment_grading:
Random iPRS exercises here and there. Really easy; should easily get full marks.

Mid-term and final exams are all MC. Should be easy to get most of them correct as well.
reviews.comment_workload:
Readings may seem confusing at first, but it will get much smoother once you get the idea. Lots of readings but only a few questions (I say less than 10%) in the mid-terms / finals are based on them. So it's your choice.

Might take time to memorize everything.

reviews.author: Aakash
reviews.title: Lectures Can Get Too Loud
reviews.comment_content: The content is quote interesting, as it focuses on the relationship between science, technology and business. It's more focused on what innovation is, and the role it plays in business contexts.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very passionate about this topic. As I understand, he happens to be one of the more prominent contributors of the field of science. technology and business. He can get a bit too loud (just go to the lectures and you'll know) while talking, but is quite sporty about it, and won't get angry if you tell him to speak softer. The TA is nonexistent, but there is no need for one, it seems.
reviews.comment_grading: It is pretty straightforward, with PRS questions, 1 midterm, and 1 final exam. The PRS questions can be answered while referring to notes, so they are free marks, essentially. However, they do require the student to be physically present in the lectures, which may detract some.
reviews.comment_workload: Nonexistent. The only homework you'll be doing is the readings, and you can just skim through them, as the lecture notes have most (not all, though) of the content of the readings.

reviews.author: Melanie Fung
reviews.comment_content:
Rich content (definitions, concepts,theories) , includes a lot about innovation and technology

Need to take time to memorise
reviews.comment_teaching:
Not really boring
Will play music before lesson starts
But almost no interaction during class as the class is too large
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean is quite high, you can only get a B- if you reach mean in final and midterms.
Lower than mean: C+
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment:
Only iprs during classes, so need to attend all classes.

1 Midterm and 1 final:
Question type: MC (need to memorise the contents in ppt)
Syllabus will be accumulated in final

reviews.author: Gee
reviews.title: Okay Grade
reviews.comment_content: They are many theories, proofs and structures to remember. It is explained in simple and direct english in detail. However, there is a huge amount of content to remember. So if you're not good in memorising I do not recommend this course for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sharif is very passionate and enthusiastic. Fluent in both Cantonese and English. He is very helpful and he spends his time to explain his lectures accurately.
reviews.comment_grading: Its tough as if you're below mean by just a bit you will only get a C+. So if you want a good grade u need to be above mean for at least one exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy Workload. Lots of weekly readings and lengthy powerpoint. However if you are good in remembering big lengthy content this course is for you.

reviews.title: bad grade
reviews.comment_content: not interesting or related in our daily life in any sense. most students just sleep at class and wait for the iprs. basically it is not relevant to any of your further studies except if you study in gcs.
reviews.comment_teaching: tutor is passionate yet since the content is fairly boring most people just sleep at class... tutor is nice and friendly and will answer your questions in email or in person.
reviews.comment_grading:
mean is around B- but exam is pretty hard
exam is only of mcq but if your english is poor it is very hard to even understand the questions, let alone answering the correct answer so only reg the course if you are confident with your english and not afraid of boring content and ok with a timeslot that breaks your timetable.
reviews.comment_workload:
only exams though much memorization is needed
in mid terms reading materials consist of 4 mcq out of 30 so we needa read those very long passages. also the exam questions are very difficult to understand and very tricky so only those who are good at english should reg the course.

reviews.author: Elijah Chan
reviews.title: Easy common core subject
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty general and not terribly interesting. The professor tried to give case studies to make the information more applicable, but those who aren't going into Social Sciences may find it a bit boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor explains concepts very clearly and very well, which makes up for the boring content. He is not than happy to listen to student questions and feedback. Plus, he plays music before class and during breaks. Overall he's just a cool guy
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading, pretty easy to get a high grade if you simply do the readings and review lecture slides
reviews.comment_workload: No homework except readings and maybe reviewing lecture notes. There will be PRS questions during lectures, so try to attend as often as possible

reviews.author: C.ko
reviews.comment_content: The course mainly examines the inter-relations of science, technology and business, ie, how they affect one another. Some of the topics are innovation and invention, pacific rim (something related to industrial revolution), etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof is quite good. He gives a lot of examples so as to illustrate different concepts or ideas. There's always break during the lectures. There's iprs.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. Mean contributed to B/B-.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. There's only a midterm and one final exam. There's a reading per week and the readings may included in exams. No assignments and presentations at all.

reviews.author: AW34
reviews.comment_content: The course divides into three main parts: Science, Technology and Business. It talks about innovations and different business models. A lot of readings are provided in order to help you to understand the in-depth course content.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Sharif is fun. He explains difficult concept in a great way repeatedly so you won't miss a thing he explains.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is okay, average grading for this course is B-. Reaching the mean score can result in B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. There are no assignments and quizzes. But there are in-class PRS exercises that counts into the total score of the course.

reviews.author: tckwokac
reviews.comment_content:
The content is good. The Science part is more about the nature of experiments, such as the idea of Karl Popper. The Technology part is more about examples.The Business part is relatively general, as I can still understand without any business background.
After midterm, the concept of innovation and industrial revolution would be discussed more profoundly.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite interactive. He would answer students' question in and out of the class, although he ran away quickly sometimes.
reviews.comment_grading: Mean is C range
reviews.comment_workload: Have 10+ readings. He encouraged us to read them, but they are not directly included in the exams.

reviews.author: Xavi
reviews.comment_content: Mostly about how science, technology and business affect each other. Not exactly interesting but not too boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pretty much just reading the powerpoint slides. The prof. claimed that he would include something he talked in the lecture in the exams but he really did not have any points other than those in the slides.
reviews.comment_grading: Got full mark in PRS. Nearly higher than the mean for 2 SD in mid term exam and higher than the mean in final exam. Still got B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Around 15 pages of reading material per week which a few  questions in the exams directly come from. But those are just some extended explanations for the points in the slides.

reviews.author: mcchanah
reviews.title: ÂîîÂ•ΩÊÑèÊÄùÂ•ΩÁàõgrade‰ΩÜworkloadÂ∞è
reviews.comment_content: I think the content is good but boring, so people easily fall asleep xdd. But I think overall is very good! The course mainly teaches some philosiphy knowledege which may make you feel confuse but I  think is useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think the professor is quite good and nice! He is so funny and humble. He will ask our opinions of his class and give improvements!
reviews.comment_grading: The mean of this course is quite high!!! Although you got around mean, you got C range easily.
reviews.comment_workload: Only PRS, 1 MIDTERM of all MC, 1 FINAL of most of MC and T/F questions.

reviews.author: Lamay
reviews.comment_content: Content is focused on mostly theoretical and big concept ideas on how Sci, Tech and Business works and their interdependence with one another. There are lots of examples and supplementary reading to expand on topics. Not particularly hard, but there is a lot of content to memorize.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof is passionate about subject and makes the lectures much more interesting. He speaks clearly, loudly (maybe a bit too loud), and often asks students if we have understood his point. Also provides 5 minutes breaks in between with music to break up the long lectures. He also shows some videos or scenes from movies as a humorous way to explain or show a topic.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading based on Midterm, Final and a small portion from PRS.
reviews.comment_workload: Typically assigns weekly reading varying from 2-10 pages of moderately dense information, but is often not required for the class and can be considered as optional.

reviews.author: Matt_cmh
reviews.comment_content: It is about the relations between science, technology and business.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof is great and the class is not boring. There will be videos shown which make the class more fun.
reviews.comment_grading: Hard to get a good grade as there are lots of people studying the course. Insufficient time is given to students for the midterm exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There are readings every week and iprs will be used to take attendance every lesson. The readings are very long with lots of difficult words. The iprs questions answered will also be counted for your final grade.

reviews.author: Joooooooo
reviews.title: Best lecturer
reviews.comment_content:
This course is about some theories and concepts raised by scientists, definitions of different business models and history of Hong Kong S&T development etc.

Some concepts are quite abstract and difficult to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is the best professor that I have ever met. His english accent is amazing. He tried his best to make students feel less bored during lectures. He gave us a 10-min break every time and played some pop music. He even gave us candies at Halloween.

He is willing to answer students' questions after class and explain thoroughly. He also respects students' opinions as he had a course review after midterm and asked us how to improve his teaching and adjust the exam format.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-Term Exam 40% (MC)
Final Exam 45% (MC)
PRS 15%

A 15%
B 40%
C 35-40%
D 5%
F Remainder
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework, readings are not tested

Just memorise everything in the ppt and you will do fine in the exam but there are a lot to remember though.

reviews.author: williswcy
reviews.title: Enthusiastic lecturers
reviews.comment_content:
Before Midterm: Approach in understanding the nature of science, influence of technology on Business, Industrial Revolution, Industrial  Leadership in Pacific Rim
After Midterm: Relevance of Science and Technology for Economic Growth, Business Innovation, Interdependence and Diffusion of Science, Technology and Business, Managing Research and Development Function (Final Cumulative)

The content is quite insightful, given a 13-week schedule is quite compact and sometimes the course moves quickly. However the material is not hard to understand so picking up is easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Sharif is one of the most enthusiastic lecturers in HKUST. His lectures are often relaxing but effective. He is able to pin point some important information and successfully delivered to us.

There are some video watching (some in Cantonese and some in English) during lectures which helps explain his point.

Most importantly, the professor is willing to listen to students' opinion on this course and make adjustment to it. This is valuable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 40% (40MC, of which 4 is from Reading Materials)
Final: 45% (40MC and 5 True or False, of which 0 is from Reading Materials and 1 from scope of Midterm Exam)
PRS: 15% (the top 15 score from a pool of 17 questions selected by lecturers. Around 22 PRS is conducted throughout the semester.)

The PRS question will not be announced in advance so you must attend the lectures.

I got a B- in this course (Midterm ~0.8 S.D. above mean, Final ~0.3 S.D. below mean, PRS full marks). This course gives grades according to rankings:
A: 15%
B: 40%
C: 35-40%
D: 5%
F: Remainder

Given band A and B accounts for over half of the class, I argue that the grading is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework. All you need to do is read the materials and finish the PRS during the lectures.

However the reading does not accounts for high exam scores so most people skip the material directly.

reviews.author: nerd
reviews.comment_content:
things that you learn from this course may not be very useful
but some of the theories are quite fun to know about
reviews.comment_teaching:
the professor teaches very well
- ppt is easy to follow
- have breaks for each lecture
- a lot of examples are provided so that you should be able to understand the content easily
**Professor is very kind!!
EXAM:
- All MC questions so memorization is not emphasised (in fact understanding is much more important)
- have readings for midterm (quite demanding)
reviews.comment_grading:
Questions are not easy for exams if you cannot understand the concepts thoroughly and have clear concepts
Vocabulary used in questions are not very easy so a certain language ability is required so to master the paper well
You need to get quite high marks in order to get A range (i.e. Final score slightly below 90% got an A- only)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is extremely low if you only aim a B range or below
- No assignments
- 1 midterm 1 final (final is before study break)
- But at least 1 PRS for 1 lecture so make sure you attend most of the lectures btw

reviews.author: Lili
reviews.title: A lot of Theories
reviews.comment_content:
The course is mainly about how Science and Technology related to Business. It is not difficult to understand the concepts.

There are also readings provided per week. Questions about the articles will be asked in mid-term so it is quite important to read them. However they wont be in in final exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching of Professor Sharif explains quite well with a lot of daily life examples to illustrate the ideas and the principle implications. Also he is very willing to listen to students' opinions. However, he speaks a bit too fast and too loud.
reviews.comment_grading:
PRS 15%
Midterm 40%
Final 45%
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy. It mainly requires understanding of the theories stated in the powerpoint.

No assignments for this course. Only mid-term and final, all MC.

reviews.author: BillChan346
reviews.title: fun and easy
reviews.comment_content:
As it is a basic course , most of the contents are quite easy.
The topics are quite boring and don't expect too much can be learnt from the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Naubahar is very humorous.

Likes to play songs during breaks.

Very responsive to your email messages
reviews.comment_grading:
PRS 15% Midterm 40%
Final 45%
Grading: B
reviews.comment_workload:
quite light workload - mid term and final exam at all.
The exams compose of MC only and include required readings but final exempts readings due to students' request.


But there are PRS questions in every lesson .
So you have to attend to the class.

reviews.author: happyhappyyoyo
reviews.comment_content: The class content are pretty easy to understand. I guess a slightly larger portion of the contents are on technology & science, rather than business.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is really passionate, he tends to explain concepts clearly in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades are okay if you put an adequate amount of time of reviewing course materials. There will be in-class PRS that affects your final grading as well.
reviews.comment_workload: Daily workload are really light. It goes heavier, but manageable when it comes to midterms (need to study lecture notes, readings and handouts), but other than that, not much assignment/ daily work.

reviews.author: heeheehaha
reviews.title: Interesting professors
reviews.comment_content:
Contains quite a lot of information in each PowerPoint and you have to understand some technical in order to get the marks.
There are many videos help you understand the materials and sometimes they are quite long and spent much of class time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interesting professor, very passionate
He gives clear outline of the course and he explains much about each topic.
reviews.comment_grading:
Higher than average in both midterms and exam but only B
The mean of midterm and exam are very high
reviews.comment_workload: No after class hw but have in class discussions which count marks, nearly every lesson has PRS question

reviews.author: Freshmanjaijai
reviews.title: strongly not recommended
reviews.comment_content:
Science Tech Business
Each component above contains around 3 PPT notes.  Not really hard to understand
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor is chill, interesting to some extent.
reviews.comment_grading:
PRS = 15
Mid term = 40
Final = 45
reviews.comment_workload: It really depends on what grade you want.  I would say you need to really work quite hard in order to get a B+ or above.  The workload mainly comes from the readings.  A lot.  I mean really A LOT.  But if you only aim for a C+/B-, this course is quite easy for you cuz what you need to do is read the ppt.

reviews.author: moses
reviews.title: Passionate instructor
reviews.comment_content: The course on how science and technology are related to business. It uses different economic modal to analyse the relation between S&T and business in different region or country. Numerous examples and case studies are discussed in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: SHARIF, Naubahar is the most passionate professor in HKUST I have ever met. His english as well as cantonese pronunciation is accurate and clear. He cares about the need of student and uses different phrases and examples to illustrate some abstract  concept to students. He will also give breaks every lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is determined by your own interest to the content and topic in the course, once you are interested in that your grade would not be too bad.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of the course is fair. A couples of readings will be included in the mid-term exam and final exam but only in small portion. Both exams are in multiple choice format and memorisation of a lot of facts is not necessary.

reviews.author: Nickname
reviews.title: Suggested to who like MC
reviews.comment_content:
The distribution of the science, technology and business are balance, but science and technology are little bit more than business.
The content is interesting and if you can understand the main concept, it is not a lot to remember.
The part about the history is the most boring, while other is ok.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Naubahar is a very humorous person, 2 hours lecture is very fast to be completed. He asked "Did I speak so fast?" frequently, and repeat and repeat again if he saw student did not give response to him. So, give response to his question, otherwise you will listen the repeated content again and again. And that part of content will be display in PRS question in the next lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: It is ok, you will go a B range if you are at mean. But mean is quite high every year. Haha, mean is nearly 7x%.
reviews.comment_workload: Reading material will be released in every week. It is quite long, but the most weird thing is those content MUST be included in at least one PRS question and exam question.

reviews.author: ny
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly definitions of concepts, but definitions are important as the course examines you on the understanding of specific terms mentioned in class.
Before midterm and final, the professor will send a document consisting of sample questions. Remember to read through it as some similar questions may be seen in the actual exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice professor who is helpful and responds to emails efficiently
Likes to play songs from youtube during breaks
reviews.comment_grading:
PRS 15%
Midterm 40%
Final 45%
Median and Mean Grade - B
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload compared to other courses
Midterm and Final exams are all MCs. Some PRS questions may also appear in the midterm or final exam.

reviews.author: dinc
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content are definitions and quite lengthy. You can just recite all of it and go for exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very nice and I think his accent is comparatively better than other UST professors. If you have any questions, you can feel free to ask him or send emails to him.
reviews.comment_grading:
PRS 15% Midterm 40% Final 45%
Grading: B
reviews.comment_workload: The course only includes midterm, final and PRS. The workload is not that high. However, the midterm and final exam materials include lecture notes and reading materials. While the reading materials are quite lengthy, it is better to review it in advance.

reviews.author: whyyyy
reviews.comment_content: The lengthy content includes scientific methods, innovations, industrial revolution and interdependence between science, technology and business. The topics are quite boring and don't expect too much to be learnt from the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Indian professor who can speak Cantonese fluently and with great English accent. He plays songs suggested by students before the lectures and at the break. You can send whatever songs you like to his email. But he likes to speak loud suddenly and walk through the whole lecture theatre to draw attention from students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade mean B-
1 midterm 40%
Final 45%
PRS 15%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light. Closed book midterm and final are composed of MC. Midterm includes required readings but final exempts readings due to students' request. Many stuff needed to be memorised. Every class conducts 1-3 PRS questions about things taught in lecture so you need to attend the lecture. At last 17 with highest marks are counted.

reviews.author: Chimney
reviews.comment_content: It's all about the relationship among Science, Tech and Business. If you have studied courses from both science and business, should be easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is funny. There were videos in classes but not that interesting. Attendance was taken randomly by PRS. He is willing to give tips and assistance to your learning.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite Good I think.
Only study the ppt can get fair grade ( B range)
If you aim at A range, you have to get nearly full mark in exam and attendance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Nothing to do.
Only mid term and finals, only MCQs
